title: Freedmen's Bureau Records: George T. Cook to R. S. Lacey, December 31, 1866
summary: In his monthly report, Cook notes that while violence against freedmen is infrequent, low wages keep them in a state of poverty. One Freedman is aggravated by the lack of room in poor houses.
keywords: Aid/Relief, Employment/Labor, Legal System, Race Relations, Violence/Crime, Women, American Civil War
